URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4791#issuecomment-508076083
 
 
   Hmm... so it looks like gcc 4.8.2 in manylinux1 may not have these APis:
   https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/atomic

pitrou commented on issue #4791: ARROW-5775: [C++] Fix thread-unsafe cached data
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4791#issuecomment-508076083
 
 
   Hmm... so it looks like gcc 4.8.2 in manylinux1 may not have these APis:
   https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/atomic
   
   https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34205880/why-does-atomic-load-with-a-shared-ptr-not-compile-with-gcc-4-9

+// Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+// or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file

+// under the License.
+
+#pragma once
+
+#include <atomic>
+#include <memory>
+#include <utility>
+
+namespace arrow {
+namespace internal {
+
+#if !defined(__clang__) && defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ < 5
+
+// atomic shared_ptr operations only appeared in gcc 5,
+// emulate them with unsafe ops on gcc 4.x.
+
+template <class T>
+std::shared_ptr<T> atomic_load(const std::shared_ptr<T>* p) {
+  return *p;
+}
+
+template <class T>
+void atomic_store(std::shared_ptr<T>* p, std::shared_ptr<T> r) {
+  *p = r;
+}
+
+#else
+
+template <class T>
+std::shared_ptr<T> atomic_load(const std::shared_ptr<T>* p) {

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The lazy initialization isn't thread-safe (it relies neither on a lock nor on an atomic).

Perhaps we need a more general "cached property" facility to handle these cases.
fields.summary: [C++] StructArray : cached boxed fields not thread-safe
